revised_title: Thermionic Work-Functions and Photo-Electric Thresholds of Alkali Metals
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on alkali metals, specifically sodium and potassium, to study their thermionic work-functions and photo-electric thresholds. They discovered that these metals have multiple work functions, meaning their surfaces are not uniform. This finding has implications for understanding the behavior of thermionic and photo-electric currents in these materials.
